cinnamon.engine.object

Class ImmutableMesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.object.ImmutableMesh
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Mesh, Identifiable

    public final class ImmutableMesh
extends Object
implements Mesh, Identifiable

    Collection of vertices, their indices for forming triangles, and texture coordinates.

    An ImmutableMesh is a direct, immutable, implementation of the Mesh interface and is designed to work in tandem with one or more TransformableMeshes. ImmutableMeshes are constructed through a ImmutableMeshBuilder, as shown below.

             float[] vertices = new float[] {0f, 0f, 1f, 0f, 1f, 1f, 0f, 1f};
         int[] indices = new int[] {0, 1, 2, 0, 2, 3};
         float[] textureCoordinates = new float[0f, 1f, 0f, 0f, 1f, 0f, 1f, 1f];

         // Builder expecting 4 vertices of two components each (i.e. 2D vertices)
         ImmutableMeshBuilder builder = new ImmutableMeshBuilder(vertices, 4, true);
         builder.setIndices(indices).setTextureCoordinates(textureCoordinates);

         ImmutableMesh mesh = builder.setName("box_mesh").create();

    • Nested Class Summary
